question: What’s the difference between a debit and a credit card?
answerChoices: Debit cards take funds from your account in real time; credit cards are billed later
Debit cards are billed later; credit cards take funds from your account in real time
Credit cards are for people age 40 and older; debit cards are for younger people
Debit cards can only be used online; credit cards can be used at the register
answer: Debit cards take funds from your account in real time; credit cards are billed later

question: What minimum percentage of income is recommended to set aside as savings each month?
What does interest on a loan mean?
answerChoices: It's the cost of borrowing money, which you pay monthly
When you're really happy about securing a loan
The total amount you'll pay over the course of the loan
The name of the bank that provides you with the loan
answer: It's the cost of borrowing money, which you pay monthly

question: What is compound interest in a savings account?
answerChoices: Additional fees
A portion of annual earnings
Money you earn on both the money you've saved and your account's accumulated interest
None of the above
answer: Money you earn on both the money you've saved and your account's accumulated interest

question: How does gross pay differ from net pay?
answerChoices: Gross pay is what you bring home after taxes; net pay is before taxes
Gross pay is before taxes; met pay is what you bring home after taxes
Gross pay is when you're not happy with your salary; net pay is when you're happy
Gross pay is when you get an advance on your paycheck; net pay is when you get your paycheck at the normal time
answer: Gross pay is before taxes; met pay is what you bring home after taxes
